ygData.subject: RE: Charming Methods
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey wait a minute are you calling Meee obtuse?  Heh heh, and I thought I caught you on one, oh well.  What can I say I like to talk and hate inaccuracy ;) I
ygData.messageBody:
Hey wait a minute are you calling Meee obtuse? Heh heh, and I thought I
caught you on one, oh well. What can I say I like to talk and hate
inaccuracy ;)

I hadn't noticed the fall part, but it makes sense since those falls are not
really straight down, how the heck does that occur? Update synching between
client and server? Of course jumping off the ramps in E Karana is not a
recommended method for escaping Mob's. Another thing I noticed, Bellowing
helps as well. That little bit it knocks them back has made the difference
for me a couple of times in Najena when I couldn't use accellerando and ran
out of stamina for jumping.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, November 11, 1999 1:08 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Charming Methods


From: <kim@...>

On Thu, 11 Nov 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> What, John made a mathematical error? I am flabbergasted! Its actually
> safer than 1.414x by a long shot so long as you are 1.414x melee range
from
> them when you turn. They follow an arc inside the corner as you turn it,
> not being smart enough to lead you and get the advantage of the triangle.

Heh. I'd deleted this from my post as being too obtuse. A
little bit of inaccuracy saves a ton of explanation.

> [ ton of explanation deleted :-) ]
>
> the trees as they run into them but you will not be. This allows one to
> outrun some Mob's without using accellerando in heavily forested areas if
> the MOB is close to your speed (like orcs). I call this scraping the tail
> off on a tree. Of course one miscalculation where you run into the tree
and
> they are on top of you.

Also, if you fall as you run down a slope, that seems to put
some extra distance between you and the mob.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@... with
the subject lol.
